context_of_use: This use case allows admins and power users to manage user accounts and perform related bulk operations within the system.
description: This use case enables admins and power users to manage user accounts and perform related bulk operations.
triggering_event: Admin or power user initiates the management of user accounts.
preconditions: Admin or power user is logged into the system.
User account management permissions are granted.
postconditions: Bulk operations are completed if applicable.
assumptions: The system has a user account management feature.
Admins and power users have the necessary permissions to manage accounts.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall enable power users to handle bulk operations.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on specific bulk operations that can be performed by power users.
main_flow: 1. Admin → System: Admin requests to manage user accounts.
2. System → Admin: System displays user account management interface.
3. Admin → System: Admin selects user accounts to manage.
4. System → Admin: System processes the selected user accounts.
5. Admin → System: Admin confirms changes to user accounts.
6. System → Admin: System updates user accounts and confirms completion.
